content.thinking: Let me analyze this document step-by-step to extract the required equity composition data: ## Document Analysis This appears to be a notarized document in Spanish that records a shareholders' meeting ("ACTA GENERAL DE ACCIONISTAS") for a company called APROGAS S.A.C. The document mentions the shareholders, their identification details, and their share ownership. Let's extract the relevant information according to the required schema. ## Company Information (Root Level) - Company Name: APROGAS S.A.C. (mentioned throughout the document) - Country: Peru (evident from "EN LA CIUDAD DE LIMA" and mentions of Peru-specific identifiers like DNI) - Tax ID: Not explicitly stated in the document, need to set as "POR REVISAR" - Document Category: "Equity Composition" (as required) ## Shareholders (Related Parties) The document mentions two shareholders: 1. TICIANO MUÑOZ SANCHEZ - Type: person - Identification: DNI N° 09163077 - Shares: 549,945 shares (based on page 1) - Page 4 lists 549,945 shares - Role: Presidente, Gerente General 2. CHANO MUÑOZ LLONTOP - Type: person - Identification: DNI N° 70008642 - Shares: 55 shares The document on page 1 states: "LOS PARTICIPANTES DE LA PRESENTE JUNTA DE ACCIONISTAS REPRESENTAN EL 100% DE LAS ACCIONES SUSCRITAS CON DERECHO A VOTO QUE HACEN UN TOTAL DE 550,000.00 SOLES." So the total shares are 550,000 shares at 1 SOL each. To calculate participation percentage: - Ticiano: 549,945 / 550,000 = 0.99990 = 99.990% - Chano: 55 / 550,000 = 0.0001 = 0.010% ## Country Identification Multiple indicators suggest Peru: - "LIMA" is mentioned repeatedly - "DNI" is the Peruvian national ID format - References to Peruvian legal codes and institutions - "SOLES" as currency (Peru's currency) ## IdentificationDetails - Source: "text_reference" - Indicators: ["Lima", "Peru", "SOLES", "DNI", "Registro de Personas Jurídicas de Lima"] - ConflictingSources: [] (no conflicts detected) - requiresReview: "true" (due to missing tax ID) Now let's create the JSON output according to the schema: ```json { "result": { "companyName": "APROGAS S.A.C.", "documentCategory": "Equity Composition", "taxId": "POR REVISAR", "country": "Perú", "identificationDetails": { "source": "text_reference", "indicators": ["Lima", "Perú", "SOLES", "DNI", "Registro de Personas Jurídicas de Lima"], "conflictingSources": [], "requiresReview": "true" }, "relatedParties": [ { "type": "person", "firstName": "Ticiano", "lastName": "Muñoz Sanchez", "identificationType": "DNI", "identificationNumber": "09163077", "relationshipType": "Shareholder", "participationPercentage": "99.990", "timeFound": "1", "job": "Gerente General" }, { "type": "person", "firstName": "Chano", "lastName": "Muñoz Llontop", "identificationType": "DNI", "identificationNumber": "70008642", "relationshipType": "Shareholder", "participationPercentage": "0.010", "timeFound": "1", "job": "" } ] }, "documentType": "company", "category": "ACC" } ``` Wait, I need to double-check a couple of things: 1. Regarding the company's RUC (Tax ID): I don't see it explicitly in the document. In Peru, companies use RUC (Registro Único de Contribuyentes). I'll leave it as "POR REVISAR". 2. The document mentions "INSCRITA EN LA PARTIDA ELECTRONICA N° 11016561 DEL REGISTRO DE PERSONAS JURÍDICAS DE LIMA" - this is a registration number, not a tax ID. 3. Let me check the share numbers again: - Ticiano: 549,945 shares - Chano: 55 shares - Total: 550,000 shares This confirms the participation percentages I calculated. 4. Checking job roles: - Ticiano is referred to as "Presidente", "Gerente General" and "ACCIONISTA" (shareholder) - Chano is referred to as "Secretario" Let me update the JSON accordingly: ```json { "result": { "companyName": "APROGAS S.A.C.", "documentCategory": "Equity Composition", "taxId": "POR REVISAR", "country": "Perú", "identificationDetails": { "source": "text_reference", "indicators": ["Lima", "Perú", "SOLES", "DNI", "Registro de Personas Jurídicas de Lima"], "conflictingSources": [], "requiresReview": "true" }, "relatedParties": [ { "type": "person", "firstName": "Ticiano", "lastName": "Muñoz Sanchez", "identificationType": "DNI", "identificationNumber": "09163077", "relationshipType": "Shareholder", "participationPercentage": "99.990", "timeFound": "1", "job": "Gerente General" }, { "type": "person", "firstName": "Chano", "lastName": "Muñoz Llontop", "identificationType": "DNI", "identificationNumber": "70008642", "relationshipType": "Shareholder", "participationPercentage": "0.010", "timeFound": "1", "job": "Secretario" } ] }, "documentType": "company", "category": "ACC" } ``` Let me check one more time: - Names are preserved with original accents (Muñoz) - Identification numbers are correctly formatted - Percentages are calculated correctly and formatted with 3 decimal places - Jobs are in Spanish as per the requirements One final check: - According to the hash tables provided, for Peru, the personal ID type should be "DNI" which matches what we extracted - For Peru, the company ID type should be "RUC" - but we don't have this info so kept as "POR REVISAR" I notice one discrepancy: in page 2 the name appears as "Chano Muñoz Sanchez" but in page 1 and other pages it's "Chano Muñoz Llontop". This seems to be an error in the document. Since it appears more frequently as "Llontop", I'll use that version but add this inconsistency to conflictingSources. Final JSON:
